abstract: Douglas Kass, the handpicked “credentialed bear” for this year’s Berkshire Hathaway meeting, says that Warren Buffett answered maybe 80 percent of his questions. But he retained a high level of respect for the billionaire.
snippet: Douglas Kass, the handpicked “credentialed bear” for this year’s Berkshire Hathaway meeting, says that Warren Buffett answered maybe 80 percent of his questions. But he retained a high level of respect for the billionaire.
lead_paragraph: OMAHA — When Douglas A. Kass first learned that Warren E. Buffett had selected him to be the official skeptic at Berkshire Hathaway‘s annual meeting this year, the hedge fund manager knew he had a lot of work to do.

headline.main: Berkshire’s Bear on Tangling With a Master of Question-Dodging

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Many of the questions at Berkshire Hathaway’s annual investor meeting dwelled on what life after Warren E. Buffett will look like. But for the chief executive of NetJets, that’s one of the least of his concerns.
snippet: Many of the questions at Berkshire Hathaway’s annual investor meeting dwelled on what life after Warren E. Buffett will look like. But for the chief executive of NetJets, that’s one of the least of his concerns.
lead_paragraph: OMAHA — Many of the questions at Berkshire Hathaway‘s annual shareholder meeting here dwelled on what life after Warren E. Buffett will look like.

headline.main: Succession at Berkshire Is Minor Concern for NetJets’ Chief

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
